sen.j: 章子内親王（しょうし（あきこ）ないしんのう、万寿3年12月9日（1027年1月19日） - 長治2年9月17日（1105年10月26日））は第68代後一条天皇第一皇女。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Shoshi(Akiko) (January 19, 1027 - October 26, 1105) was the first princess of the sixty-eighth Emperor Goichijo.
Imperial Princess Shoshi (her given name can also be pronounced "Akiko") (January 19, 1027 - October 26, 1105) was the first daughter of the sixty-eighth emperor, Emperor Goichijo.
sen.cmt: Expressions like "first princess of the emperor" are a bit vague and can be difficult to understand. In addition to the usual meaning of "princess", the Kenkyusha Online Dictionary also gives "daughter of a monarch" as a possible translation for 皇女. Please try to translate the meaning according to the context rather than the individual words.Also, if you just put "Akiko" in parentheses without any explanation, a native speaker of English will not necessarily be able to work out what this is supposed to mean. Try to add a short phrase to help the reader.
sen.e: Imperial Princess Shoshi (her given name can also be pronounced "Akiko") (January 19, 1027 - October 26, 1105) was the first daughter of the sixty-eighth emperor, Emperor Goichijo.

sen.j: 母は藤原道長女・中宮藤原威子。
sen.e: Her mother was the second consort of an emperor, FUJIWARA no Ishi (Takeko), who was a daughter of FUJIWARA no Michinaga.
Her mother was FUJIWARA no Ishi, who was a daughter of FUJIWARA no Michinaga and the second consort of an emperor.
sen.cmt: As FUJIWARA no Ishi is not really the main focus of this page, I don't think it is necessary to provide alternative readings of her name (unless the Japanese expressly does so).
sen.e: Her mother was FUJIWARA no Ishi, who was a daughter of FUJIWARA no Michinaga and the second consort of an emperor.

sen.j: 第70代後冷泉天皇中宮、女院。
sen.e: She was the second consort of the seventieth Emperor Goreizei, and nyoin (an honorific title for the mother of emperor(s), etc).
She was the second consort of the seventieth Emperor, Emperor Goreizei, and held the title Nyoin (an honorific title for the mother of an emperor, etc).
sen.cmt: It would be helpful if the translator could indicate how they arrived at the translation for a term such as "女院" or label it as 仮訳 if it is their own creation. I cannot imagine what the "etc." means in the definition of Nyoin. The brother/sister of an Emperor, perhaps? Please check whether the "etc." is necessary.
sen.e: She was the second consort of the seventieth Emperor, Emperor Goreizei, and held the title Nyoin (an honorific title for the mother of an emperor, etc).

sen.j: 院号は二条院。
sen.e: Her ingo (a title of respect given to close female relatives of the Emperor or a woman of comparable standing) was Nijoin.

sen.j: 同母妹に馨子内親王（後三条天皇中宮）。
sen.e: Her half sister was Imperial Princess Keishi (Kaoruko)(the second consort of Emperor Gosanjo).

sen.e: In 1027, she received a title of Imperial Princess by the emperor.

sen.e: She was given the title of jugo and ippon (the first of Imperial Princes' rank) with chakko (dressing children a hakama to celebrate their growth) at the same time in 1030.

sen.j: 同9年（1036年）に父後一条天皇と母中宮威子が相次いで崩御、幼くして両親と死別した。
sen.e: She lost her father, Emperor Goichijo, and her mother, the second consort of an emperor, Ishi (Takeko), one after another in 1036, so she lost both of her parents at a young age.

sen.e: She had chakumo (dressing adult woman in kimono for the first time) in 1037 and made her bridal entry into the court of the Crown Prince of Imperial Prince Chikahito (who would later become Emperor Goreizei) at the age of twelve.

sen.e: With juzen (accession to the throne as a result of sb's abdication) of Imperial Prince Chikahito in 1045, she received a title of nyogo (a court title given to a consort of the Emperor) and was officially appointed as the second consort of the emperor in 1046.

sen.e: She shaved her head to entered the priesthood, became the Grand Empress Dowager in 1069, and named herself as Nijyoin by receiving a title of ingo in 1074.

sen.e: She was the first child of Emperor Goichijo, not an Imperial prince as expected, but her parents loved her very much.

sen.e: After her parents' death, she was raised by her grandmother (maternal aunt), FUJIWARA no Shoshi (Akiko) and made her bridal entry into the court as the Crown Princess.

sen.j: 藤原道長の死後はその子息たちが後宮政策で互いに牽制し合う状況にあり、当時は関白藤原頼通の娘がいまだ幼かったため恐らく折衷案として、道長一族に連なり上東門院の後見を受ける章子内親王が選ばれたと思われる。
sen.e: After FUJIWARA no Michinaga's death, his sons warned against each other regarding the inner palace policy, so it would appear that Imperial Princess Shoshi(Akiko) was placed under the guardianship of Jotomonin as one of Michinaga clan, and this was probably the compromise plan since the daughter of FUJIWARA no Yorimichi was too young at that time.

sen.j: 後に頼通の娘藤原寛子入内に際して、内親王がこのまま中宮でよいと言ったという話が『栄花物語』に見えるが、これは先帝後朱雀天皇の後宮で同じく中宮であった禎子内親王（章子内親王には母方の従姉妹にあたる）が頼通の養女藤原嫄子の立后で皇后に押し上げられ、宮中入りもままならなかった状況を見ていたためでもあるだろう。
sen.e: When FUJIWARA no Kanshi (Hiroko), a daughter of Yorimichi, made her bridal entry into the court in later times, "Eiga monogatari (Tale of Flowering Fortunes)" described that Imperial Princess said she would continue to be the second consort of an emperor, but it was because she saw the situation where Imperial Princess Teishi (Yoshiko/Sadako)(maternal cousin for Imperial Princess Shoshi(Akiko)), the second consort of the former Emperor Gosuzaku at the inner palace, was forced to become an empress by the order from FUJIWARA no Genshi, adopted daughter of Yorimichi, and barely entered the Imperial Court.

sen.j: とはいえ、高貴でおっとりした人柄であったという章子内親王は夫後冷泉天皇が他の妃を寵愛しても気にすることなく、従って頼通らとの関係も穏やかだった。
sen.e: However, Imperial Princess Shoshi(Akiko) was a noble and gentle person, so she did not mind when her husband, Emperor Goreizei, loved another princess, so the relationship with Yorimichi was peaceful.

sen.e: In addition, after her husband and the guardian, Jotomonin, died, she even received a title of nyoingo (an honorific title for the mother of emperor(s), etc) which was the first time for the empress who was not the empress dowager to receive it, and lived a stable life.

sen.j: （ただし女院宣下については、時の白河天皇女御藤原賢子を立后させるためだったともいわれ、非国母の故か院分受領は給わっていない）
sen.e: (However, it was said that in order for FUJIWARA no Kenshi, a nyogo of Emperor Shirakawa, to become an empress, she received a title of nyoin and did not receive a title of inbun zuryo (a head of administrative supervisors for a Imperial Palace), it maybe because she was not the empress dowager.) Maybe due to the thick blood relationship with her husband, they were less fortunate to have any children, but because of that, she did not get involved in any Imperial succession conflict and lived out her peaceful life, so maybe she was happy in a way.

sen.j: 余りにも濃すぎる血縁関係のためか、夫帝との間にはついに御子は恵まれなかったが、それゆえに皇位継承争いに巻き込まれることもなく平穏な生涯をまっとうできたのは、ある意味で内親王にとっては幸せだったのかもしれない。
sen.e: Maybe due to the thick blood relationship with her husband, they were less fortunate not to have any children, but because of that, she did not get involved in any Imperial succession conflict and lived out her peaceful life, so maybe she was happy in a way.
